I'm writing to the Town Council to express my concerns about the proposed changes to the Palgrave Estates Residential Community.

In my 19 years living in the area, I don't remember ever seeing any litter. The residents take responsibility for protecting the environment as well as their 2-3 acre lots. My experience from visiting friends who live in townhouses is completely different. There always seems to be garbage (fast food bags, Tim Hortons cups, wrappers, etc) in all the ditches and beside every stop sign. It is just a symptom of what happens when you cluster a lot of people together. They don't take personal ownership of the land around them. People crammed together is never a good thing for the environment. (I won't even get into the disastrous environmental issues that can arise when trying to have 18+ homes on 1 septic tank)

Because we are in the Oak Ridges Moraine I would have hoped that any proposed changes would involve limiting and/or stopping any new development whatsoever, not bringing in townhouse clusters which traditionally have been detrimental to the environment.
